table.caption: Description of configuration options for baremetal

tr.td: (StrOpt) The backend to use for bare-metal database
(StrOpt) Default kernel image ID used in deployment phase
(StrOpt) Default ramdisk image ID used in deployment phase
(ListOpt) A list of additional capabilities corresponding to flavor_extra_specs for this compute host to advertise. Valid entries are name=value, pairs For example, "key1:val1, key2:val2"
(IntOpt) Maximal number of retries for IPMI operations
(StrOpt) Template file for injected network config
(StrOpt) Additional append parameters for baremetal PXE boot
(StrOpt) This gets passed to Neutron as the bootfile dhcp parameter.
(BoolOpt) If set, pass the network configuration details to the initramfs via cmdline.
(StrOpt) The SQLAlchemy connection string used to connect to the bare-metal database
(StrOpt) Path to baremetal terminal SSL cert(PEM)
(StrOpt) Path to directory stores pidfiles of baremetal_terminal
(StrOpt) Baremetal compute node's tftp root path
(BoolOpt) If True, enable file injection for network info, files and admin password
(BoolOpt) Do not set this out of dev/test environments. If a node does not have a fixed PXE IP address, volumes are exported with globally opened ACL
(StrOpt) The ssh key for virtual power host_user
(StrOpt) User to execute virtual power commands as
(StrOpt) IP or name to virtual power host
(IntOpt) Port to use for ssh to virtual power host
(StrOpt) Base command to use for virtual power(vbox, virsh)
(StrOpt) The XenAPI VIF driver using XenServer Network APIs.
